Definition at line 34 of file GrFrustum.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GrFrustum::GrFrustum (  )  [inline]

creates an empty frustum. This is so a frustum can be created and then defined later. An empty frustum will have no area.

Definition at line 201 of file GrFrustum.cpp.

void GrFrustum::BuildHull ( SVec3 *  verts  )  const

builds a hull using the frustum corners. This does NOT include any additional planes, only the 6 original planes. This returns 18 vertices in a triangle list format.

this assumes non-orthograpic projection. >=| right.

Definition at line 697 of file GrFrustum.cpp.

int GrFrustum::FindRelativeLoc ( const MVec3 &  pt0,
const MVec3 &  pt1 
) const

-1 = outside, 1 = inside, 0 = both.

check to see if either of the points is inside the frustum.

if neither point is inside the frustum, we need to check to see if both points are outside of the frustum, but the line itself intersects with the frustum.

we found a point where the segment intersects with the plane... check to see if the point is 'inside' all other planes.

skip if we're testing the same plane.

point is not inside. Check any other intersections.

if the intersection point is inside the frustum, then the segment intersects with the frustum.

not inside the frustum.

check all points against the plane passed in.

all points are on the same side of the plane.

Definition at line 456 of file GrFrustum.cpp.

void GrFrustum::GetCrossSection ( UFastArray< MVec3 > &  hull,
const MPlane &  plane 
) const

returns the 'best' cross section of the frustum.

finish implementing this!!!

first, just do a 'dumb' approach by finding all of the points where all of the original 6 planes intersect with eachother and the plane passed in.

for each orignal plane.

for each subsequent orignal plane.

if the current planes and the plane passed in intersect, add the point where they intersect to the current point cloud.

perform a 2D qhull on the points to ensure that they're in the proper order.

now, clip the current hull with any extra planes.

Definition at line 62 of file GrFrustum.h.

bool GrFrustum::IsAABoxInside ( const MAABox &  box  )  const

there are 8 points on a cube.

for each plane...

for each point...

we are checking to see if all points are on the negative side of a single plane.

check to see if we went through the entire loop without breaking... if so, then all points are on the negative side of a single plane. Thus, the test failed.

the box collides with the frustum.

bool GrFrustum::IsHull (  )  const [inline]

the frustum is only a hull if it's position is on or is in the positive half-space of all of the planes.
